solution_line_template: He drives for a total of {drive_time_each_way}*{num_ways}=<<{drive_time_each_way}*{num_ways}={total_driving_time}>>{total_driving_time} hours
So he spends {total_driving_time}*{beach_time_multiplier} =<<{total_driving_time}*{beach_time_multiplier}={beach_time}>>{beach_time} hours at the beach
That means the total trip took {beach_time}+{total_driving_time}=<<{beach_time}+{total_driving_time}={total_trip_time}>>{total_trip_time} hours
